abstract: world fuel services getting somewhat positive media coverage , study finds .
article: media headlines about world fuel services have been trending somewhat positive on tuesday , according to accern . the research firm scores the sentiment of media coverage by analyzing more than twenty million blog and news sources in real-time . accern ranks coverage of public companies on a scale of negative one to positive one , with scores closest to one being the most favorable . world fuel services earned a coverage optimism score of 0.07 on accern 's scale . accern also assigned news coverage about the oil and gas company an impact score of 45.8259530183471 out of 100 , indicating that recent media coverage is somewhat unlikely to have an effect on the company 's share price in the near term .

world fuel services opened at $ 28.31 on tuesday . world fuel services has a 1 year low of $ 25.80 and a 1 year high of $ 47.49 . the company has a market cap of $ 1,910.00 , a p/e ratio of 80.89 , a p/e/g ratio of 2.52 and a beta of 0.92 . the company has a current ratio of 1.63 , a quick ratio of 1.42 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.58 . world fuel services last announced its quarterly earnings data on thursday , october 26th . the oil and gas company reported $ 0.60 eps for the quarter , meeting the zacks ' consensus estimate of $ 0.60 .

the firm had revenue of $ 8.54 billion for the quarter , compared to the consensus estimate of $ 8.19 billion . world fuel services had a negative net margin of 0.44 % and a negative return on equity of 7.92 % . the firm 's revenue was up 15.4 % on a year-over-year basis . during the same period in the previous year , the firm posted $ 0.82 earnings per share . equities analysts anticipate that world fuel services will post 2.24 eps for the current fiscal year . the firm also recently announced a quarterly dividend , which will be paid on friday , january 5th .

shareholders of record on friday , december 15th will be given a $ 0.06 dividend . this represents a $ 0.24 annualized dividend and a yield of 0.85 % . the ex-dividend date of this dividend is thursday , december 14th . world fuel services 's dividend payout ratio is 68.57 % . world fuel services announced that its board has approved a stock buyback program on wednesday , october 4th that allows the company to repurchase $ 100.00 million in shares . this repurchase authorization allows the oil and gas company to purchase shares of its stock through open market purchases .

shares repurchase programs are typically a sign that the company 's leadership believes its stock is undervalued . separately , bank of america downgraded shares of world fuel services from a `` neutral '' rating to an `` underperform '' rating and lowered their price objective for the company from $ 41.00 to $ 36.00 in a research report on tuesday , september 26th . warning : `` world fuel services getting somewhat positive media coverage , study finds '' was reported by watch list news and is the sole property of of watch list news . if you are reading this article on another publication , it was illegally stolen and republished in violation of us & international trademark and copyright law .

the correct version of this article can be viewed at fuel services company profileworld fuel services corporation is engaged in providing aviation , marine and land energy , logistics and technology solutions to customers and suppliers around the world . the company operates through three segments : aviation , marine and land . in its aviation segment , the company offers fuel and related products and services .
